moves.1... c5: good old silicain in my way though
moves.2. Bc4 Nc6: i always do this second in hopes of Qf3
moves.3. Qf3 Ne5: the best answer to the fool's mate
moves.6. Nf3 d5: force the queen to move again
moves.7. exd5 exd5 8. Qf4 Qe7+: i figured he'll block with the knight or the queen
moves.12. Nb5 Qc6 13. Ne5: gives the knight on B5 away
moves.14. Qxb5 Bxb5+ 15. Ke1 Bd6 16. Nd3 O-O: time to snatch the e file
moves.19. b3 d4: if he brings his bishop out it will do him no good at all thanks to the pawns at d4 and c5
moves.23... Bg3 24. Ne1 Bf5 25. d3 Rxe1+: trade offs are good when up in matterial
moves.36. Kd3 Rxa4: house keeping gotta get these stupid pieces of the board
moves.37. Bg5 Bxc4+: what do i care about my knight?
moves.40. Bxf6 gxf6: well that takes care of minor pieces
moves.46. Kf4 Qf1+ 47. Kg3 Rxg2+ 48. Kh4 Qh1#: oldest mate in the book but still effective
